nodes.name: Sticky Note

parameters.content:
## Activate the workflow to make the MCP Trigger work
In order to make the MCP server available, you need to activate the workflow.

Then copy the Production URL of the MCP Trigger and paste it in the corresponding MCP Client tool.

nodes.name: Sticky Note2

parameters.content:
# Try these example requests with the AI Agent

### My Functions MCP
1. Use your tools to convert this text to lower case: `EXAMPLE TeXt`

2. Use your tools to convert this text to upper case: `example TeXt`

3. Generate 5 random user data, please.

4. Please obtain 3 jokes.




### Calendar MCP
5. What is my schedule for next week?

6. I have a meeting with John tomorrow at 2pm. Please add it to my Calendar.

7. Adjust the time of my meeting with John tomorrow from 2pm to 4pm, please.

8. Cancel my meeting with John, tomorrow.

parameters.content:
## Google Calendar tools require credentials
If you don't have your Google Credentials set up in n8n yet, watch [this]({{ $env.WEBHOOK_URL }} video to learn how to do it.

If you are using n8n Cloud plans, it's very intuitive to setup and you may not even need the tutorial.

parameters.content:
## Why model 4o? ðŸ‘†
After testing 4o-mini it had some difficulties handling the calendar requests, while the 4o model handled it with ease.

Depending on your prompt and tools, 4o-mini might be able to work well too, but it requires further testing.

nodes.name: Workflow Documentation

parameters.content:
# Build your first AI MCP Server

## Overview
Automated workflow: Build your first AI MCP Server. This workflow integrates 15 different services: stickyNote, httpRequest, agent, mcpClientTool, switch. It contains 39 nodes and follows best practices for error handling and security.

## Workflow Details
- **Total Nodes**: 39
- **Node Types**: 15
- **Error Handling**: âœ… Implemented
- **Security**: âœ… Hardened (no sensitive data)
- **Documentation**: âœ… Complete

## Node Breakdown
- **AI Agent**: agent
- **SearchEvent**: googleCalendarTool
- **CreateEvent**: googleCalendarTool
- **UpdateEvent**: googleCalendarTool
- **DeleteEvent**: googleCalendarTool
- **Google Calendar MCP**: mcpTrigger
- **When Executed by Another Workflow**: executeWorkflowTrigger
- **Switch**: switch
- **Convert Text to Upper Case**: set
- **Convert Text to Lower Case**: set
- ... and 29 more nodes

## Usage Instructions
1. **Configure Credentials**: Set up all required API keys and credentials
2. **Update Variables**: Replace any placeholder values with actual data
3. **Test Workflow**: Run in test mode to verify functionality
4. **Deploy**: Activate the workflow for production use

## Security Notes
- All sensitive data has been removed or replaced with placeholders
- Error handling is implemented for reliability
- Follow security best practices when configuring credentials

## Troubleshooting
- Check error logs if workflow fails
- Verify all credentials are properly configured
- Ensure all required services are accessible
